title: Goodbye to League: git responsible or git out
body:
I've played League since season 1 or 2.

I'm not anyone important, but I've stayed through removal of items I enjoyed, and stuck around while my favorite champs went from playable to unplayable.

The recent delve into full garbo politics is what it took for me to uninstall.

Just a couple tips before I disappear into nothing:
1) if you're dbags and treat a group unfairly, then apologize and stop being dbags. this is called taking responsibility for your actions, and it is a thing that adults do.
2) you can't up for being a dbag by being a dbag in a different way. This is still a thing called being responsible and it is a thing that adults do.
3) companies that let themselves get bodied by feelings don't survive. Instead, set standards, make them public, and stick to them. This happens to be an aspect of responsibility which adults do.
4) you can't allow immature people to destroy a culture of dialogue, reason, and responsibility by virtue of their uncontrolled feelings.

Not only do I not expect anyone to reply here, but I won't be back to check anyway, so... I encourage you to not waste your time.

Thanks for the years of fun.  Sad to see them end.
